hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity-Driven Momentum Fade at Key BTC Price Levels
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC approaches round number levels ($90K, $95K, $100K) in BULL regimes, liquidity thinness creates exaggerated moves that reverse 70% of the time within 4 hours when accompanied by declining spot volume and increasing futures funding rates >0.03%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Round numbers attract stop-losses and take-profits, creating liquidity vacuums. High funding rates indicate overcrowded long positioning. When spot volume declines at these levels, it suggests lack of genuine buying interest, making the breakout attempt likely to fail.
entry_conditions: BTC within 0.5% of major round number ($90K, $95K, $100K)
Spot volume declines by >25% from 24-hour average as price approaches level
Aggregated bid-ask spread widens by >20% from 4-hour average

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2.5% reversal from round number OR return to 4-hour VWAP
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakthrough round number by >1% with increasing volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If BTC breaks through round number with >30% volume increase and funding rates continue rising >0.05%.
